Before 1895, the Phillip Street extension and addition of mansard roof and dome

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: GoogleMapsStreetView showing the Phillip St extension etc.

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/51979177@N02/] did some excellent research on the earlier photo which suggests that this image is before January 1888, when the last statue 'Art' was hoisted into the niche seen vacant (see note). Ref - trove.nla.gov.au/ndp/del/article/13675831

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content:
And 'Science' (see middle note) was added October 1883.  Thanks [http://www.flickr.com/photos/51979177@N02/]!

So date of this photo is 1883-88.  So far.

comment.author: 51979177@N02
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] Yo! Statue dating in action! nla.gov.au/nla.news-article28372353 per this January 1884 SMH item (column 4 ; 4th from bottom) a cab had a near miss with the tram at this intersection...the tram was pulling out of the 'waiting shed'.
